intro: Tryphera, commonly known as the common thornapple, is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae). It is a herbaceous plant that typically grows in disturbed soils and open areas. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with a rough texture and a distinct central vein. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The fruit is a rounded, fleshy berry that contains several seeds.
